DataElement.preferredName: Most Recent Laboratory Procedure CA-125  Performed Age
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Age when most recent CA-125 was performed

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Most Recent Laboratory Procedure CA-125  Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._An antigen expressed by tissues derived from mullerian epithelium (tubal, endometrial and endocervical) or celomic epithelium (mesothelial cells of the pleura, pericardium and peritoneum).  Although its biochemical nature has not been clearly defined, CA125 has been described as a glycosylated, high-molecular-weight protein that may be released from damaged cells.  Measurable in plasma, CA125 is a sensitive, nonspecific tumour marker for ovarian cancer; as such it is much more useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment of ovarian cancer than for the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  Elevated plasma CA125 may occur in association with other malignancies and non-malignant gynecologic disorders._Executed and carried through to completion._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Nearest to the present time._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Although its biochemical nature has not been clearly defined, CA125 has been described as a glycosylated, high-molecular-weight protein that may be released from damaged cells.  Measurable in plasma, CA125 is a sensitive, nonspecific tumour marker for ovarian cancer; as such it is much more useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment of ovarian cancer than for the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  Elevated plasma CA125 may occur in association with other malignancies and non-malignant gynecologic disorders.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

An antigen expressed by tissues derived from mullerian epithelium (tubal, endometrial and endocervical) or celomic epithelium (mesothelial cells of the pleura, pericardium and peritoneum).  Although its biochemical nature has not been clearly defined, CA125 has been described as a glycosylated, high-molecular-weight protein that may be released from damaged cells.  Measurable in plasma, CA125 is a sensitive, nonspecific tumor marker for ovarian cancer; as such it is much more useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment of ovarian cancer than for the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  Elevated plasma CA125 may occur in association with other malignancies and non-malignant gynecologic disorders. (NCI04)
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
